snippet: Officials cited serious safety concerns in taking action against the companies, many of them based in Chinatown.
abstract: Federal officials, citing safety hazards, order 26 companies to stop operating their buses that pick up passengers at curbsides all over Manhattan’s Chinatown and haul them to cities up and down the East Coast; crackdown is the most sweeping action ever taken against American passenger-bus operators and is intended to chasten other low-budget companies that might try to evade safety regulations and the relatively small pool of inspectors who enforce them

byline.contributor: Zena Barakat, Jeffrey E. Singer and Justin Sullivan contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Officials cited serious safety concerns in taking action against the companies, many of them based in Chinatown.

headline.seo: Federal Officials Shut Down 26 Bus Operators
headline.main: Federal Officials Shut Down 26 Bus Operators
headline.print_headline: 26 Operators of Low-Cost Buses Are Halted by U.S. Over Safety
